value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video we are going through the DAX function KEEPFILTERS. KEEPFILTERS will remove the behaviour that CALCULATE has where it removes the filters available.  Looking for Part 1 video?  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ewjRItLlgG8  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/keepfilters-function-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #8: CALCULATE (Part 2)
value.excerpt: The calculate function is the most useful measure available in DAX. Let's go through how it works in this part 2!  Calculate Part 1: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-oDpOfhgmzA Download Power BI file:https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/calculate-dax  PREVIOUS VIDEO: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q4jePhzKtbU

value.title: DAX Fridays! #84: Get values from another table with inactive relationships
value.excerpt: It is world's cup fever: FIFA world cup 2018 in Russia!!! And we dont want to miss anything right?  That is where Power BI comes to the rescue :)  I am going to build a Power BI file to follow the world cup and I decided to show you how I create it while creating it :)  In the first video, I downloaded

value.title: DAX Fridays! #90: Understanding LOOKUPVALUES error
value.excerpt: Have you got the following error when using the DAX function LOOKUPVALUES?  "A table of multiple values was supplied where a single value was expected"  in this video, I will show you why that error happens and what you need to do to resolve it and use the function as intended. value.title: DAX Fridays! #91: Sum child values into the parent
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to sum child values into the parent when you are dealing with hierarchies in Power BI.  This video is based on an example shown in the previous DAX Fridays! video, so I recommend you to watch that first: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8OWQ7Xl3m0  Happy holidays!

value.title: DAX Fridays! #95: Binning, Frequency and relative frequency | Data profiler
value.excerpt: This is the first of a series of videos about data profiling and descriptive statistics. In today's video, I will show you how to bin data,  calculate the frequency and relative frequency using DAX.  What you think about the series? let me know in the comment box.  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/median-dax-functions

value.title: DAX Fridays! #96: MEDIAN, AVERAGE, MEAN, MODE | The Bill Gates Effect
value.excerpt: In part 2 of the data profiling series, we are going to talk about MEAN, AVERAGE, MODE AND MEDIAN and try to explain them with a story, what I call the Bill Gates Effect.  Main topics?  Is average a good measure ? When is average a bad metric to use? Calculate median Calculate mode.  Here is the website

value.title: DAX Fridays! #97: STANDARD DEVIATION EXPLAINED | Who is the best player, LeBron or Durant?
value.excerpt: Who is the best player, Duran or LeBron? Let's find out using statistics and standard deviation.  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Download file here: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/stdev-s-dax  More on STATISTCAL DAX FUNCTIONS here: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDz00l_jz6zxc8iinR39euGqFm4SDabBf

value.title: DAX Beginners - SUM Vs SUMX in Power BI - What, When and Where?
value.excerpt: Welcome to Wed with Dax beginner series. During this episode, we will talk about two interesting DAX expressions. SUM and SUMX. We will compare both DAX expressions in detail. First, I will explain When to use SUM and when to use SUMX. We will talk about the difference between SUM and SUMX functions

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Building a Virtual Relationship in Power BI   Basics of TREATAS DAX Function
value.excerpt: TreatAs is an interesting function with multiple use cases in Power BI. Let's see how you can use this function.
